channel.title: Porfolio on Christopher Pintado
channel.description: Recent content in my Porfolio on Christopher Pintado

item.title: Analytical Review for Consolidating Habitat Mapping Within Europe: Insights from Portugal, Spain, and France
item.description: This paper addresses the challenges of standardizing habitat classification across three conterminous European countries by presenting a comparative analysis of habitat data for Portugal, Spain and France with focus on the cross-border regions between these countries. This master's dissertation contributes to the InCASE project -In Situ showcase Supporting Climate and Environmental Monitoring in Europe- funded by the European Commission in support to the European Environmental Agency (EEA) and the Copernicus InSitu Component

item.title: Experimental Approaches for Geometric Correction
item.description: GoExperimental outlook for geometric correction of various remote imaging sources utilizing manual and automatics approach. This project tries to convey the procedure of geometric corrections of satellite images that are not georeferenced directly, and are assigned arbitrary coordinate units of pixels, and converting them into a desired georeferenced coordinate system, using both manual and automatic models.

item.title: Radiometric Image Correction
item.description: Having geometrically referenced images poses challenges, including atmospheric conditions, varied illumination due to solar position at acquisition time, and reliefinduced shadows. These factors deviate from the desired traits for remote sensing. This endeavor aims to outline the procedures involved in acquiring and radiometrically correcting satellite orthoimages, like Landsat-5 TM, utilizing both manual and automatic applications. The goal of radiometric correction is to transform digital sensor values into meaningful physical quantities, such as reflectance.

item.title: Experimental Display of Fotointerpretation
item.description: Description: The photointerpretation of the FincaL.POL boundary involved analyzing surfaces, resolving ambiguities in vegetation and water features, and addressing technical issues to ensure accurate, validated results.

item.title: Mastering SQL: Building a Foundation Through Practice
item.description: Description: Iâ€™ve developed a solid foundation in SQL through hands-on practice, focusing on database design, query optimization, and data analysis with tools like MiraBosc

item.title: Project 6: Car Price Estimator
item.description: Description:As an aspiring GIS professional, HTML development has become an essential tool in my skill set, enabling me to create structured, interactive, and visually engaging web pages. My focus lies in crafting clean and semantic HTML5 code that ensures both functionality and accessibility.
